{"step_by_step_thinking": "Protein precipitation is a method used to concentrate and purify proteins. A. Trichloroacetic acid is a commonly used precipitant for proteins. B. Acetyl alcohol and acetone are also used for protein precipitation. D. Salts of heavy metals can also precipitate proteins. However, C. Adjusting pH to other than the isoelectric point does not precipitate proteins. Instead, it can denature them or change their charge, but it does not cause them to precipitate out of solution.", "answer_choice": "C"}
